setup.comment: defining a database that will be referred by the vid 'db' later
Creating Two Tables For Orders and Total Number Of Sales Of GBI As "sales_de","saledetails_de"
setup.execute:
create table sales_de( orderid int, vendorid int, sale_time varchar(100)
)
create table saledetails_de( orderdetailid int unique AUTO_INCREMENT, materialid int, orderid int, count int)
setup.comment: By Using Bean Id,Defining All Months from 2009-2011 With An Unique Identity using class "DateTimeGenerator" To Generate Data As Per Months By Defining Them As An Element In The Program

In Consideration To Real Data Of Overall Orders In Germany in 2009(i.e 405000 Orders), Considering 1% Of Overall Orders As Total Orders Of GBI in 2009(i.e 4050 Orders), Generating Data For Orders In 2009
In Consideration With Different Sources And Taking An Approximate Value, Generating 5.91% Of Orders In Table "sales_de" For Month Janury 2009(i.e 239 Orders)
In Consideration With Different Sources And Taking An Approximate Value, Generating 4.261% Of Orders In February Of Year 2009(i.e 171 Orders)

generate.name: sales_de
generate.comment: Defining A Variable As "weightings" For Importing Data From CSV File For Mapping With A Weighted Distribution
Defining An Attribute "vendorid" To Take Reference From Table "vendor_de" Which Is Defined In DATABASE And Assigning Values As Per Weightage Given In CSV File
Defining An Attribute "sale_time" To Generate Date As Per Defined Date Identity
Number Of Sales Per Order Is Randomly Generated From 1 to 100

generate.name: saledetails_de
generate.comment: Defining An Attribute "orderid" To Generate Values Referred To Attribute "orderid" From Table "sales_de"
Defining Attribute "materialid" To Take Values From Table "material_us" Which Is Defined In DATABASE
Number Of Products Count Value Is Given Randomly Between 1 to 20
